ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Yes, I would recommend this course. It provided an excellent overview to important works of the 1530s by Rabelais, Marguerite de Navarre, and ClÃ©ment Marot as well as in-depth analysis of the individual work themselves. The chronology traced in the course allowed for a more general understanding of how literature reflected and responded to religious and political issues of the time.

The subject is not the easiest. Reading Moyen FranÃ§ais is required, but it becomes easier after a few weeks. However it is worth taking the course, to expand one's knowledge of 16th century literature. The course is interesting and an enjoyable challenge.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: It added to my knowledge of an important canon in French literature.
